screenSummary.value: On this screen, the Play Area has a source that can stream Alpha particles onto a thin foil. A highly magnified view of the foil is shown in an observation window. Sliders adjust energy of the alpha particles and the number of protons and neutrons comprising the atoms in the foil. The Control Area has radio buttons to toggle between atomic and nuclear scale views, buttons to pause and step incrementally through observations, and a button to reset the sim. Stream alpha particles to begin observations. Look for alpha particles and atom sliders to play, or read on for details about the observation window.

atomSpaceDescription.value: An atomic scale view of the foil is shown. Portions of five tightly packed atoms are visible, with three nuclei visible in the scene.

nucleusSpaceDescription.value: An nuclear scale view of the foil is shown. A single atomic nucleus is visible with a representative number of protons and neutrons.

alphaParticlesHelpText.value: Start and stop stream of alpha particles.

energySliderDescription.value: Adjust the energy of particles in the alpha particle stream

traceCheckboxDescription.value: Observe particles in stream with or without traces

protonSliderDescription.value: Adjust number of protons per atom in foil.

neutronSliderDescription.value: Adjust number of neutrons per atom in foil.

switchScaleDescription.value: Observe experiments at nuclear or atomic scales.

otherOptionsDescription.value: Observe details by pausing continuous stream, or streaming in steps.
